info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 27 at 10:47AM EDT until June 27 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast West Virginia, including the following areas, Summers and Western Greenbrier.
* WHEN...From 2 PM EDT this afternoon through this evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A backdoor cold front will provide a focus for storm initiation later this afternoon. As storms develop, storm motions will be very slow given the flow aloft is weak. This combined with substantial moisture across the area will lead to a flash flood threat across west central Virginia and portions of WE West Virginia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING
